intro: Roettlera primulifolia, commonly known as the white bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, white to pale blue flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, preferring well-drained soil and full sun exposure. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are often hairy as well. Roettlera primulifolia is valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes cultivated in gardens for its delicate, early spring blooms.
